articles.title: Microsoft Stock Is Way Too Expensive Given These Risks Piling Up
articles.content: Microsoft remains one of the most expensive mega-cap tech stocks despite AI challenges. Learn more about MSFT stock and its valuation concerns.

articles.title: Is The iPhone Losing Its Buzz Among Teens? Piper Sandler Finds Out
articles.content: Piper Sandler analyst Matt Farrell surveyed around 13,500 teens to see Apple Inc.‘s (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhone upgrade expectation among them. Notably, Apple unveiled the iPhone 16 in September, and early pre-order data shows that demand for the iPhone 16 may be lower than expected due to a lack of reasons for existing iPhone owners to upgrade to the latest model. The analyst’s survey results indicate that 22% of teens plan to upgrade to an iPhone 16 this Fall/Winter, slightly down from 23% in Fall 20

articles.title: Heard on the Street: AI Isn't Selling PCs Yet
articles.content: Personal computers may be getting smarter, but that alone isn't enough to get them flying off the shelves.  Lenovo and HP saw slight gains in unit sales during the quarter while Dell and Apple saw their sales fall on a year-over-year basis, IDC said.  “Even with a full lineup of Windows-based AI PCs for both Arm and x86 in the third quarter of 2024, AI PCs did not boost the demand for PCs since buyers have yet to see their clear benefits or business value,” Gartner analyst Mikako Kitagawa noted in Wednesday’s report.

articles.title: Apple, Nvidia Supplier TSMC Reports Third Quarter Sales Above Wall Street Estimates
articles.content: TSMC reported sales figures for September on Wednesday, completing its third quarter data, which came in above what analysts had expected.

articles.title: Apple iPhone 16 May Be a Want, Not a Need, for Teens, Survey Shows
articles.content: Piper Sandler surveyed thousands of teens and found that 22% plan to upgrade to the latest iPhone model this fall/winter, down from prior years.
